intro: Homolostyles tenerrima, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and gelatinous berries. The plant attaches to host trees through its haustellum, drawing water and nutrients from the host. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
